020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertFalse;

022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotEquals;
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
024import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNull;

026import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;

042import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;

048/**
049 * Extension of {@code ContextBaseTestCase} to validate the
050 * extra functionality of this implementation.
051 */
052public class ServletWebContextTestCase extends ContextBaseTestWeb<ServletWebContext> {
053
054    // ----------------------------------------------------- Instance Variables
055
056    /**
057     * Servlet API Objects - Context
058     */
059    protected ServletContext scontext = null;
060
061    /**
062     * Servlet API Objects - Request
063     */
064    protected HttpServletRequest request = null;
065
066    /**
067     * Servlet API Objects - Response
068     */
069    protected HttpServletResponse response = null;
070
071    /**
072     * Servlet API Objects - Session
073     */
074    protected HttpSession session = null;
075
076    // -------------------------------------------------- Overall Test Methods
077
078    /**
079     * Set up instance variables required by this test case.
080     */
081    @Override
082    @BeforeEach
083    public void init() {
084        scontext = new MockServletContext();
085        scontext.setAttribute("akey1", "avalue1");
086        scontext.setAttribute("akey2", "avalue2");
087        scontext.setAttribute("akey3", "avalue3");
088        scontext.setAttribute("akey4", "avalue4");
089        ((MockServletContext) scontext).addInitParameter("ikey1", "ivalue1");
090        ((MockServletContext) scontext).addInitParameter("ikey2", "ivalue2");
091        ((MockServletContext) scontext).addInitParameter("ikey3", "ivalue3");
092        session = new MockHttpSession(scontext);
093        session.setAttribute("skey1", "svalue1");
094        session.setAttribute("skey2", "svalue2");
095        session.setAttribute("skey3", "svalue3");
096        request = new MockHttpServletRequest("/context", "/servlet",
097                                             "/path/info", "a=b&c=d",
098                                             session);
099        request.setAttribute("rkey1", "rvalue1");
100        request.setAttribute("rkey2", "rvalue2");
101        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addHeader("hkey1", "hvalue1");
102        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addHeader("hkey2", "hvalue2a");
103        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addHeader("hkey2", "hvalue2b");
104        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addParameter("pkey1", "pvalue1");
105        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addParameter("pkey2", "pvalue2a");
106        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addParameter("pkey2", "pvalue2b");
107        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addCookie("ckey1", "cvalue1");
108        ((MockHttpServletRequest) request).addCookie("ckey2", "cvalue2");
109        response = new MockHttpServletResponse();
110        context = createContext();
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Tear down instance variables required by this test case.
115     */
116    @Override
117    @AfterEach
118    public void tearDown() {
119        scontext = null;
120        session = null;
121        request = null;
122        response = null;
123        context = null;
124    }
125
126    // ------------------------------------------------ Individual Test Methods
127
128    /**
129     * Test {@code getApplicationScope()}
130     */
131    @Test
132    public void testApplicationScope() {
133        Map<String, Object> map = context.getApplicationScope();
134        assertNotNull(map);
135
136        // Initial contents
137        checkMapSize(map, 4);
138        assertEquals("avalue1", map.get("akey1"));
139        assertEquals("avalue2", map.get("akey2"));
140        assertEquals("avalue3", map.get("akey3"));
141        assertEquals("avalue4", map.get("akey4"));
142
143        // Transparency - entrySet()
144        checkEntrySet(map, true);
145
146        // Transparency - removal via web object
147        scontext.removeAttribute("akey1");
148        checkMapSize(map, 3);
149        assertNull(map.get("akey1"));
150
151        // Transparency - removal via map
152        map.remove("akey2");
153        checkMapSize(map, 2);
154        assertNull(scontext.getAttribute("akey2"));
155
156        // Transparency - addition via web object
157        scontext.setAttribute("akeyA", "avalueA");
158        checkMapSize(map, 3);
159        assertEquals("avalueA", map.get("akeyA"));
160
161        // Transparency - addition via map
162        map.put("akeyB", "avalueB");
163        checkMapSize(map, 4);
164        assertEquals("avalueB", scontext.getAttribute("akeyB"));
165
166        // Transparency - replacement via web object
167        scontext.setAttribute("akeyA", "newvalueA");
168        checkMapSize(map, 4);
169        assertEquals("newvalueA", map.get("akeyA"));
170
171        // Transparency - replacement via map
172        map.put("akeyB", "newvalueB");
173        assertEquals(4, map.size());
174        assertEquals("newvalueB", scontext.getAttribute("akeyB"));
175
176        // Clearing the map
177        map.clear();
178        checkMapSize(map, 0);
179
180        // Test putAll()
181        Map<String, String> values = new HashMap<>();
182        values.put("1", "One");
183        values.put("2", "Two");
184        map.putAll(values);
185        assertEquals("One", map.get("1"), "putAll(1)");
186        assertEquals("Two", map.get("2"), "putAll(2)");
187        checkMapSize(map, 2);
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Test {@code equals()} and {@code hashCode()}
192     * Copied from ContextBaseTestCase with customized creation of "other"
193     */
194    @Override
195    @Test
196    public void testEquals() {
197        // FIXME - ServletWebContext needs a better equals()
198
199        // Compare to self
200        assertTrue(context.equals(context));
201        assertEquals(context.hashCode(), context.hashCode());
202
203        // Compare to equivalent instance
204        Context other = new ServletWebContext(scontext, request, response);
205        // assertTrue(context.equals(other));
206        assertEquals(context.hashCode(), other.hashCode());
207
208        // Compare to non-equivalent instance - other modified
209        other.put("bop", "bop value");
210        // assertFalse(context.equals(other));
211        assertNotEquals(context.hashCode(), other.hashCode());
212
213        // Compare to non-equivalent instance - self modified
214        other = new ServletWebContext(scontext, request, response);
215        context.put("bop", "bop value");
216        // assertFalse(context.equals(other));
217        assertNotEquals(context.hashCode(), other.hashCode());
218    }
219
220    /**
221     * Test {@code getHeader()}
222     */
223    @Test
224    public void testHeader() {
225        Map<String, String> map = context.getHeader();
226        assertNotNull(map);
227
228        // Initial contents
229        checkMapSize(map, 2);
230        assertEquals("hvalue1", map.get("hkey1"));
231        assertEquals("hvalue2a", map.get("hkey2"));
232        assertTrue(map.containsKey("hkey1"));
233        assertTrue(map.containsKey("hkey2"));
234        assertTrue(map.containsValue("hvalue1"));
235        assertTrue(map.containsValue("hvalue2a"));
236
237        // Transparency - entrySet()
238        checkEntrySet(map, false);
239
240        // Unsupported operations on read-only map
241        try {
242            map.clear();
243            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
244        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
245            ; // expected result
246        }
247        try {
248            map.put("hkey3", "hvalue3");
249            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
250        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
251            ; // expected result
252        }
253        try {
254            map.putAll(new HashMap<>());
255            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
256        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
257            ; // expected result
258        }
259        try {
260            map.remove("hkey1");
261            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
262        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
263            ; // expected result
264        }
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Test {@code getHeaderValues()}
269     */
270    @Test
271    public void testHeaderValues() {
272        Map<String, String[]> map = context.getHeaderValues();
273        assertNotNull(map);
274
275        // Initial contents
276        checkMapSize(map, 2);
277        Object value1 = map.get("hkey1");
278        assertNotNull(value1);
279        assertInstanceOf(String[].class, value1);
280        String values1[] = (String[]) value1;
281        assertEquals(1, values1.length);
282        assertEquals("hvalue1", values1[0]);
283        Object value2 = map.get("hkey2");
284        assertNotNull(value2);
285        assertInstanceOf(String[].class, value2);
286        String values2[] = (String[]) value2;
287        assertEquals(2, values2.length);
288        assertEquals("hvalue2a", values2[0]);
289        assertEquals("hvalue2b", values2[1]);
290        assertTrue(map.containsKey("hkey1"));
291        assertTrue(map.containsKey("hkey2"));
292        assertTrue(map.containsValue(values1));
293        assertTrue(map.containsValue(values2));
294
295        // Transparency - entrySet()
296        checkEntrySet(map, false);
297
298        // Unsupported operations on read-only map
299        try {
300            map.clear();
301            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
302        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
303            ; // expected result
304        }
305        try {
306            map.put("hkey3", values2);
307            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
308        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
309            ; // expected result
310        }
311        try {
312            map.putAll(new HashMap<>());
313            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
314        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
315            ; // expected result
316        }
317        try {
318            map.remove("hkey1");
319            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
320        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
321            ; // expected result
322        }
323    }
324
325    /**
326     * Test {@code getInitParam()}
327     */
328    @Test
329    public void testInitParam() {
330        Map<String, String> map = context.getInitParam();
331        assertNotNull(map);
332
333        // Initial contents
334        checkMapSize(map, 3);
335        assertEquals("ivalue1", map.get("ikey1"));
336        assertEquals("ivalue2", map.get("ikey2"));
337        assertEquals("ivalue3", map.get("ikey3"));
338        assertTrue(map.containsKey("ikey1"));
339        assertTrue(map.containsKey("ikey2"));
340        assertTrue(map.containsKey("ikey3"));
341        assertTrue(map.containsValue("ivalue1"));
342        assertTrue(map.containsValue("ivalue2"));
343        assertTrue(map.containsValue("ivalue3"));
344
345        // Transparency - entrySet()
346        checkEntrySet(map, false);
347
348        // Unsupported operations on read-only map
349        try {
350            map.clear();
351            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
352        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
353            ; // expected result
354        }
355        try {
356            map.put("ikey4", "ivalue4");
357            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
358        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
359            ; // expected result
360        }
361        try {
362            map.putAll(new HashMap<>());
363            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
364        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
365            ; // expected result
366        }
367        try {
368            map.remove("ikey1");
369            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
370        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
371            ; // expected result
372        }
373    }

377     */
378    @Test
379    public void testParam() {
380        Map<String, String> map = context.getParam();
381        assertNotNull(map);
382
383        // Initial contents
384        checkMapSize(map, 2);
385        assertEquals("pvalue1", map.get("pkey1"));
386        assertEquals("pvalue2a", map.get("pkey2"));
387        assertTrue(map.containsKey("pkey1"));
388        assertTrue(map.containsKey("pkey2"));
389        assertTrue(map.containsValue("pvalue1"));
390        assertTrue(map.containsValue("pvalue2a"));
391
392        checkEntrySet(map, false);
393
394        // Unsupported operations on read-only map
395        try {
396            map.clear();
397            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
398        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
399            ; // expected result
400        }
401        try {
402            map.put("pkey3", "pvalue3");
403            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
404        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
405            ; // expected result
406        }
407        try {
408            map.putAll(new HashMap<>());
409            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
410        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
411            ; // expected result
412        }
413        try {
414            map.remove("pkey1");

421    /**
422     * Test {@code getParamValues()}
423     */
424    @Test
425    public void testParamValues() {
426        Map<String, String[]> map = context.getParamValues();
427        assertNotNull(map);
428
429        // Initial contents
430        checkMapSize(map, 2);
431        Object value1 = map.get("pkey1");
432        assertNotNull(value1);
433        assertInstanceOf(String[].class, value1);
434        String values1[] = (String[]) value1;
435        assertEquals(1, values1.length);
436        assertEquals("pvalue1", values1[0]);
437        Object value2 = map.get("pkey2");
438        assertNotNull(value2);
439        assertInstanceOf(String[].class, value2);
440        String values2[] = (String[]) value2;
441        assertEquals(2, values2.length);
442        assertEquals("pvalue2a", values2[0]);
443        assertEquals("pvalue2b", values2[1]);
444        assertTrue(map.containsKey("pkey1"));
445        assertTrue(map.containsKey("pkey2"));
446        assertTrue(map.containsValue(values1));
447        assertTrue(map.containsValue(values2));
448
449        // Unsupported operations on read-only map
450        try {
451            map.clear();
452            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
453        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
454            ; // expected result
455        }
456        try {
457            map.put("pkey3", values2);
458            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
459        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
460            ; // expected result
461        }
462        try {
463            map.putAll(new HashMap<>());
464            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
465        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
466            ; // expected result
467        }
468        try {
469            map.remove("pkey1");
470            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
471        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
472            ; // expected result
473        }
474    }

476    /**
477     * Test {@code getCookies()}
478     */
479    @Test
480    public void testCookies() {
481        Map<String, Cookie> map = context.getCookies();
482        assertNotNull(map);
483
484        // Initial contents
485        checkMapSize(map, 2);
486        Cookie cookie1 = map.get("ckey1");
487        assertNotNull(cookie1);
488        assertEquals("cvalue1", cookie1.getValue());
489        Cookie cookie2 = map.get("ckey2");
490        assertNotNull(cookie2);
491        assertEquals("cvalue2", cookie2.getValue());
492        assertTrue(map.containsKey("ckey1"));
493        assertTrue(map.containsKey("ckey2"));
494        assertTrue(map.containsValue(cookie1));
495        assertTrue(map.containsValue(cookie2));
496
497        // Unsupported operations on read-only map
498        try {
499            map.clear();
500            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
501        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
502            ; // expected result
503        }
504        try {
505            map.put("ckey3", new Cookie("XXX", "XXX"));
506            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
507        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
508            ; // expected result
509        }
510        try {
511            map.putAll(new HashMap<>());
512            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
513        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
514            ; // expected result
515        }
516        try {
517            map.remove("ckey1");
518            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
519        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
520            ; // expected result
521        }
522    }
523
524    /**
525     * Test state of newly created instance
526     */
527    @Override
528    @Test
529    public void testPristine() {
530        super.testPristine();
531
532        // Properties should all be non-null
533        assertNotNull(context.getApplicationScope());
534        assertNotNull(context.getHeader());
535        assertNotNull(context.getHeaderValues());
536        assertNotNull(context.getInitParam());
537        assertNotNull(context.getParam());
538        assertNotNull(context.getParamValues());
539        assertNotNull(context.getCookies());
540        assertNotNull(context.getRequestScope());
541        assertNotNull(context.getSessionScope());
542
543        // Attribute-property transparency
544        assertTrue(context.getApplicationScope() ==
545                     context.get("applicationScope"));
546        assertTrue(context.getHeader() ==
547                     context.get("header"));
548        assertTrue(context.getHeaderValues() ==
549                     context.get("headerValues"));
550        assertTrue(context.getInitParam() ==
551                     context.get("initParam"));
552        assertTrue(context.getParam() ==
553                     context.get("param"));
554        assertTrue(context.getParamValues() ==
555                     context.get("paramValues"));
556        assertTrue(context.getCookies() ==
557                     context.get("cookies"));
558        assertTrue(context.getRequestScope() ==
559                     context.get("requestScope"));
560        assertTrue(context.getSessionScope() ==
561                     context.get("sessionScope"));
562    }
563
564    /**
565     * Test {@code release()}
566     */
567    @Test
568    public void testRelease() {
569        context.release();
570
571        // Properties should all be null
572        assertNull(context.getApplicationScope());
573        assertNull(context.getHeader());
574        assertNull(context.getHeaderValues());
575        assertNull(context.getInitParam());
576        assertNull(context.getParam());
577        assertNull(context.getParamValues());
578        assertNull(context.getCookies());
579        assertNull(context.getRequestScope());
580        assertNull(context.getSessionScope());
581
582        // Attributes should all be null
583        assertNull(context.get("applicationScope"));
584        assertNull(context.get("header"));
585        assertNull(context.get("headerValues"));
586        assertNull(context.get("initParam"));
587        assertNull(context.get("param"));
588        assertNull(context.get("paramValues"));
589        assertNull(context.get("cookies"));
590        assertNull(context.get("requestScope"));
591        assertNull(context.get("sessionScope"));
592    }
593
594    /**
595     * Test {@code getRequestScope()}
596     */
597    @Test
598    public void testRequestScope() {
599        Map<String, Object> map = context.getRequestScope();
600        assertNotNull(map);
601
602        // Initial contents
603        checkMapSize(map, 2);
604        assertEquals("rvalue1", map.get("rkey1"));
605        assertEquals("rvalue2", map.get("rkey2"));
606
607        // Transparency - entrySet()
608        checkEntrySet(map, true);
609
610        // Transparency - removal via web object
611        request.removeAttribute("rkey1");
612        checkMapSize(map, 1);
613        assertNull(map.get("rkey1"));
614
615       // Transparency - removal via map
616        map.remove("rkey2");
617        checkMapSize(map, 0);
618        assertNull(request.getAttribute("rkey2"));
619
620        // Transparency - addition via web object
621        request.setAttribute("rkeyA", "rvalueA");
622        checkMapSize(map, 1);
623        assertEquals("rvalueA", map.get("rkeyA"));
624
625        // Transparency - addition via map
626        map.put("rkeyB", "rvalueB");
627        checkMapSize(map, 2);
628        assertEquals("rvalueB", request.getAttribute("rkeyB"));
629
630        // Transparency - replacement via web object
631        request.setAttribute("rkeyA", "newvalueA");
632        checkMapSize(map, 2);
633        assertEquals("newvalueA", map.get("rkeyA"));
634
635        // Transparency - replacement via map
636        map.put("rkeyB", "newvalueB");
637        checkMapSize(map, 2);
638        assertEquals("newvalueB", request.getAttribute("rkeyB"));
639
640        // Clearing the map
641        map.clear();
642        checkMapSize(map, 0);
643
644        // Test putAll()
645        Map<String, String> values = new HashMap<>();
646        values.put("1", "One");
647        values.put("2", "Two");
648        map.putAll(values);
649        assertEquals("One", map.get("1"), "putAll(1)");
650        assertEquals("Two", map.get("2"), "putAll(2)");
651        checkMapSize(map, 2);
652    }
653
654    /**
655     * Test {@code getSessionScope()}
656     */
657    @Test
658    public void testSessionScope() {
659        Map<String, Object> map = context.getSessionScope();
660        assertNotNull(map);
661
662        // Initial contents
663        checkMapSize(map, 3);
664        assertEquals("svalue1", map.get("skey1"));
665        assertEquals("svalue2", map.get("skey2"));
666        assertEquals("svalue3", map.get("skey3"));
667
668        // Transparency - entrySet()
669        checkEntrySet(map, true);
670
671        // Transparency - removal via web object
672        session.removeAttribute("skey1");
673        checkMapSize(map, 2);
674        assertNull(map.get("skey1"));
675
676        // Transparency - removal via map
677        map.remove("skey2");
678        checkMapSize(map, 1);
679        assertNull(session.getAttribute("skey2"));
680
681        // Transparency - addition via web object
682        session.setAttribute("skeyA", "svalueA");
683        checkMapSize(map, 2);
684        assertEquals("svalueA", map.get("skeyA"));
685
686        // Transparency - addition via map
687        map.put("skeyB", "svalueB");
688        checkMapSize(map, 3);
689        assertEquals("svalueB", session.getAttribute("skeyB"));
690
691        // Transparency - replacement via web object
692        session.setAttribute("skeyA", "newvalueA");
693        checkMapSize(map, 3);
694        assertEquals("newvalueA", map.get("skeyA"));
695
696        // Transparency - replacement via map
697        map.put("skeyB", "newvalueB");
698        checkMapSize(map, 3);
699        assertEquals("newvalueB", session.getAttribute("skeyB"));
700
701        // Clearing the map
702        map.clear();
703        checkMapSize(map, 0);
704
705        // Test putAll()
706        Map<String, String> values = new HashMap<>();
707        values.put("1", "One");
708        values.put("2", "Two");
709        map.putAll(values);
710        assertEquals("One", map.get("1"), "putAll(1)");
711        assertEquals("Two", map.get("2"), "putAll(2)");
712        checkMapSize(map, 2);
713    }
714
715    /**
716     * Test {@code getSessionScope()} without Session
717     */
718    @Test
719    public void testSessionScopeWithoutSession() {
720        // Create a Context without a session
721        ServletWebContext ctx = new ServletWebContext(scontext,
722           new MockHttpServletRequest(), response);
723        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(A)");
724
725        // Get the session Map & check session doesn't exist
726        Map<String, Object> sessionMap = ctx.getSessionScope();
727        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(B)");
728        assertNotNull(sessionMap, "Session Map(A)");
729
730        // test clear()
731        sessionMap.clear();
732        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(C)");
733
734        // test containsKey()
735        assertFalse(sessionMap.containsKey("ABC"), "containsKey()");
736        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(D)");
737
738        // test containsValue()
739        assertFalse(sessionMap.containsValue("ABC"), "containsValue()");
740        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(E)");
741
742        // test entrySet()
743        Set<Entry<String, Object>> entrySet = sessionMap.entrySet();
744        assertNotNull(entrySet, "entrySet");
745        assertEquals(0, entrySet.size(), "entrySet Size");
746        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(F)");
747
748        // test equals()
749        assertFalse(sessionMap.equals(Collections.singletonMap("ABC", "ABC")), "equals()");
750        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(G)");
751
752        // test get()
753        assertNull(sessionMap.get("ABC"), "get()");
754        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(H)");
755
756        // test hashCode()
757        sessionMap.hashCode();
758        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(I)");
759
760        // test isEmpty()
761        assertTrue(sessionMap.isEmpty(), "isEmpty()");
762        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(J)");
763
764        // test keySet()
765        Set<String> keySet = sessionMap.keySet();
766        assertNotNull(keySet, "keySet");
767        assertEquals(0, keySet.size(), "keySet Size");
768        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(K)");
769
770        // test putAll() with an empty Map
771        sessionMap.putAll(new HashMap<>());
772        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(L)");
773
774        // test remove()
775        assertNull(sessionMap.remove("ABC"), "remove()");
776        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(M)");
777
778        // test size()
779        assertEquals(0, sessionMap.size(), "size() Size");
780        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(N)");
781
782        // test values()
783        Collection<Object> values = sessionMap.values();
784        assertNotNull(values, "values");
785        assertEquals(0, values.size(), "values Size");
786        assertNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(O)");
787
788        // test put()
789        try {
790            assertNull(sessionMap.put("ABC", "XYZ"), "put()");
791            assertNotNull(ctx.getRequest().getSession(false), "Session(P)");
792        } catch(UnsupportedOperationException ex) {
793            // expected: currently MockHttpServletRequest throws this
794            //           when trying to create a HttpSession
795        }
796    }
797
798    // ------------------------------------------------------- Protected Methods
799
800    protected void checkMapSize(Map<String, ?> map, int size) {
801        // Check reported size of the map
802        assertEquals(size, map.size());
803        // Iterate over key set
804        int nk = 0;
805        Iterator<String> keys = map.keySet().iterator();
806        while (keys.hasNext()) {
807            keys.next();
808            nk++;
809        }
810        assertEquals(size, nk);
811        // Iterate over entry set
812        int nv = 0;
813        Iterator<?> values = map.entrySet().iterator();
814        while (values.hasNext()) {
815            values.next();
816            nv++;
817        }
818        assertEquals(size, nv);
819        // Count the values
820        assertEquals(size, map.values().size());
821    }
822
823    /**
824     * Test to ensure proper entrySet() and are modifiable optionally
825     *
826     * @param map to test
827     * @param modifiable {@code true} if map is modifiable
828     */
829    protected void checkEntrySet(Map<String, ?> map, boolean modifiable) {
830        assertTrue(map.size() > 1);
831        Set<?> entries = map.entrySet();
832        assertEquals(map.size(), entries.size());
833        Object o = entries.iterator().next();
834
835        assertInstanceOf(Map.Entry.class, o);
836
837        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
838        Map.Entry<?, Object> mapEntry = (Map.Entry<?, Object>)o;
839        if (!modifiable) {
840            try {
841                mapEntry.setValue(new Object());
842                fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
843            } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
844                ; // expected result
845            }
846        } else {
847            // Should pass and not throw UnsupportedOperationException
848            mapEntry.setValue(mapEntry.setValue(new Object()));
849        }
850    }
851
852    /**
853     * Create a new instance of the appropriate Context type for this test case
854     *
855     * @return a new instance of the appropriate Context type
856     */
857    @Override
858    protected ServletWebContext createContext() {
859        return new ServletWebContext(scontext, request, response);
860    }
861}
